intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. moellendorfianum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It features basal rosettes of dark green, hairy leaves that are often lobed or toothed. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in dense, flat-topped clusters during the summer months. Its flowering stems are usually unbranched and bear several flower heads. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and is characterized by its robust growth and medicinal properties.
